Text.Value: None other. She spoke to me - she actually spoke to me! And she gave me a mission.
Let's move on. Perhaps this mission will prove real - or not.
No. This is different... very different.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Long pause before answering, as if listening to something. Finally opens her eyes and speaks
EditorData.NodeContext: Pleased/tinged with awe. She feels a presence, and hears its voice. (though the player themselves do not hear it)

Text.Value: There's something more I need to do, or the trials will have been in vain.
What's wrong?
Don't worry. This place has been empty for years - the sacrifice can't be a simple mortal. More likely it's a monster - and we're well-versed in dealing with those, aren't we?
Snap out of it.
It's Lady Shar, isn't it? I felt her presence.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This QN only if the previous passive check was succeeded

Text.Value: Yes. I know it must seem like I pulled this out of thin air, but that's how Lady Shar chose to reveal herself to me. You'll see for yourself, soon enough.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: SH approves of player for at least 30

Text.Value: Supposedly in the library we saw before - we should go back to it.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Flagged impossible for now until the correct flag for entering the library is available.

Text.Value: Glance around.
If the Nightsinger has called upon you, then I will do whatever I can to help.
*You detect the gentlest of presences disturbing the temple's ancient, stale air. It seems to encircle Shadowheart, welcoming her.*
What's going on? Tell me.
A sacrifice? You intend to kill some innocent down here?
My lady. Shar. You may have felt her, but I heard her. She gave me a mission.
Yes, we're right where we need to be, under her gaze. This is the right path - let's continue.
We need to find that spear.
Spare me the scepticism - she said it was my special purpose, for my ears alone. You'll see for yourself, soon enough.
All right. Where is this spear?
This isn't another of your 'episodes', is it?
Thank you, brother. I'll remember your help, if I succeed. As will my Lady.
Thank you, sister. I'll remember your help, if I succeed. As will my Lady.
Thank you, kin. I'll remember your help, if I succeed. As will my Lady.
Without it, the sacrifice to my Lady will be in vain, and I won't be blessed as a Dark Justiciar.
It's fine, really. I just feel we're on the right track. I'm right where I need to be - under Lady Shar's gaze.
This is nonsense - we've already cleared the way forward.
There's a library in this place somewhere. That's where I need to look.
We need to get that spear - there's a library in this place somewhere. That's where I need to look.
It's real. I felt her presence - I heard her voice. You'll see for yourself, soon enough.
Nothing. Nothing's wrong at all.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Long pause before answering, as if listening to something. Finally opens her eyes and speaks
EditorData.NodeContext: Pleased/tinged with awe. She feels a presence, and hears its voice. (though the player themselves do not hear it)

Text.Value: The way forward will be of little importance if I don't fulfil my mission. If you've any sense, you'll help me.
I felt something - a presence. What was it?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This QN only if the previous passive check was succeeded

Text.Value: There is a holy weapon hidden away - the Spear of Night. I have to claim it, then use it to make a sacrifice in Lady Shar's inner sanctum. If I succeed, I'll become a Dark Justiciar.

EditorData.NodeContext: Excited, getting a little worked up.

Text.Value: As luck would have it, we have the spear already. Time to move on.
Lady Shar asks much of you. Will you make a blood sacrifice?
Your goddess is using you to quench her bloodlust. Is this truly what you want? To spill innocent blood?
You really want to go through with this? A blood sacrifice just to appease Shar?
You're not going to turn against me, are you?
It's fine. But we're on the right path. I'm right where I need to be - under Lady Shar's gaze.
We need to get that spear - supposedly it's in the library we saw before.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Flagged impossible for now until the correct flag for entering the library is available.

Text.Value: You don't understand. There's something I need to do, or the trials will have been in vain.

EditorData.NodeContext: Elated, brushing off the player's reprimand.

Text.Value: Don't go soft on me now - this is hardly the first life we've taken. Besides, this place has been empty for years - the sacrifice can't be a simple mortal. More likely a monster.
Wait...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: SH pauses, sensing something. She closes her eyes, concentrating
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Uses the same branch as the ACM but without the Inclusion nodes
EditorData.NodeContext: Hesitant, as if she's not sure the player actually said anything.

Text.Value: And you just figured this out by yourself, just now?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This QN only if the player failed a passive check earlier in the dialogue.

Text.Value: Lady Shar's presence. I felt her too - we're right where we need to be, under her gaze. This is the right path - let's continue.

Synopsis: When Shadowheart enters the Shar Temple for the first time Shar speaks to her. Shar wants Shadowheart to find the Spear of Night and use it to kill Nightsong. Shar will tell Shadowheart where to find the spear.
